Pre-Game Insights: Wales are in a new era after the retirement of star player Gareth Bale.
The first round of the UEFA Nations League 2024-25 will include the Dragons hosting Turkey at Cardiff City Stadium.
Getting a new era started following the appointment of Craig Bellamy, Wales will be desperate to make an early statement here.
Previous results of the Wales football team have been disappointing and they will look to get a win to boost their confidence for sure.
Turkey will start as slight favourites despite being the away team but the Welsh threat cannot be overlooked.
Turkey went all the way to the Quarter-Final of the European Championship and performed well against strong opposition.
Turkey has some top-quality players on their side and they will look to finish the group at the top.
Brennan Johnson (Wales) has a wide variety of skill range that allows him to be deployed in several different roles including as a number 10 or as a winger.
Arda Guler (Turkey) effortlessly takes on multiple defenders and with his low centre of gravity he can dribble past opposition players easily.
The average number of goals in meetings between Wales and Turkey is 1.6.
Their last meeting was a draw.
The Dragons score 0.8 goals in a match against Turkey and Turkey score 0.8 goals against Wales (on average).
Daniel James will not be available for the match as he left the team camp due to a hamstring injury.
Turkey doesn’t have any injury issues and will have a fully fit squad available for the match.
Total Matches: 9, Wales: 4, Turkey: 3, Draws: 2
Predicted Lineups: Wales (3-4-2-1): Ward(GK); Rodon, Cabango, Davies; Roberts, James, Ampadu, Williams; Wilson, Johnson; Matondo
Predicted Lineups: Turkey (5-4-1): Gunok(GK); Muldur, Ayhan, Akaydin, Demiral, Kadioglu; Guler, Ozcan, Calhanoglu, Yildiz; Yilmaz
Both sides will be looking to give each other a tough challenge on the pitch, fans can expect an intense match and both teams will look to get the win to get that confidence boost.
Wales as the home team will surely try to put pressure on the opposition team and will look to get a good advantage on Turkey but most probably Turkey will win this fixture.
Prediction: Wales 1-3 Turkey
